title: 113_s274
content: The Act may be referred to as the "Children Eating Well Act" or the "CHEW Act." Definitions are provided in Section 2. In this Act, terms such as "elementary school", "local educational agency", "secondary school", and "State educational agency" are defined according to the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The term "programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education" refers to initiatives that enhance students' ability to choose and consume healthy foods. Programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education aim to increase students' ability to recognize, choose, and consume healthy foods, reflect various influences on healthy eating, provide necessary education for making healthy decisions as adults, and utilize nutritional materials. The curr_chunk emphasizes the importance of providing education on healthy eating to students using scientifically sound and developmentally appropriate nutritional materials supported by the Dietary Guidelines for Americans. The curr_chunk includes professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service workers to ensure the implementation of scientifically sound and developmentally appropriate nutritional materials supported by the Dietary Guidelines for Americans. The curr_chunk focuses on professional development programs for teachers, school staff, and food service workers to promote healthy eating and nutrition in schools under the National Nutrition Monitoring and Related Research Act of 1990. Programs to promote healthy eating and nutrition education are established under the National Nutrition Monitoring and Related Research Act of 1990. Local educational agencies receiving assistance under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 must develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education for all schools served by the agency. This may include integrating such programs into various activities. Local educational agencies must develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education for all schools. This includes integrating programs into various times and locations within schools, using educational materials, lessons, and activities emphasizing knowledge and appreciation of nutrition. Local educational agencies must develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education for all schools, including integrating programs into various times and locations within schools, using educational materials, lessons, and activities emphasizing knowledge and appreciation of healthy foods and a balanced diet and lifestyle. The curr_chunk emphasizes the importance of a variety of healthy foods, balanced diet and lifestyle, integrating healthy eating with physical activity, and promoting wellness activities to improve student knowledge and skills related to nutrition without focusing on child weight. The curr_chunk highlights the need for schools to integrate healthy eating with physical activity, promote wellness activities, and monitor efforts to improve nutrition understanding among students. The curr_chunk emphasizes the importance of schools consulting various stakeholders to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education among students. The curr_chunk focuses on implementing programs for healthy eating and nutrition education, including consulting with stakeholders and collaborating with organizations with nutrition expertise. The curr_chunk emphasizes collaborating with organizations with nutrition expertise to develop and implement programs for promoting healthy eating and nutrition education. The curr_chunk highlights the importance of collaborating with various organizations and government authorities to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education. The curr_chunk emphasizes collaboration with Team Nutrition, State agencies, and school wellness councils to design and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools. The curr_chunk focuses on collaborating with school wellness councils to develop and implement programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools, in alignment with the local school wellness policy. The curr_chunk emphasizes promoting healthy eating and nutrition education in schools by integrating programs with the local school wellness policy and providing professional development to staff members. Each State educational agency must comply with these requirements under part A of title I of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The curr_chunk focuses on State educational agencies submitting reports on programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education, including monitoring data from local educational agencies. The Education Act of 1965 requires State educational agencies to submit reports on programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education, including monitoring data from local educational agencies. Additionally, an inter-agency task force will review nutrition education curricula and recommend effective programs for elementary and secondary schools. The Education Act of 1965 mandates State educational agencies to report on programs promoting healthy eating and nutrition education. An inter-agency task force, consisting of the Secretaries of Education, Agriculture, and Health and Human Services, will review and recommend effective nutrition education programs for elementary and secondary schools. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal years 2014 through 2019.
